senses.sense_definition: Having or resembling a spathe (a large sheathing leaf enclosing a flower cluster).

examples.text: The botanist identified the plant by its distinctive <w>spathose</w> bracts that covered the bloom.
Many tropical plants exhibit a <w>spathose</w> structure that protects the delicate flowers inside.

senses.sense_definition: Resembling spar minerals in texture or cleavage; spathic.

examples.text: The geologist examined the <w>spathose</w> iron ore found in the sediment layers.
This mineral sample has a <w>spathose</w> appearance due to its crystalline cleavage.
